text: Not particularly betfair related more general betting, wonder if anyone can help. When calculating EV for a bet if I have a “true price” obviously the calc is fairly simple but I’ve some markets where dead heats are common. If I know how often that a dead heat would occur (from my calculations) how could I calculate the EV to account for that. Or should that be included in my original estimates price and factored in there?

elements.text: Not particularly betfair related more general betting, wonder if anyone can help. When calculating EV for a bet if I have a “true price” obviously the calc is fairly simple but I’ve some markets where dead heats are common. If I know how often that a dead heat would occur (from my calculations) how could I calculate the EV to account for that. Or should that be included in my original estimates price and factored in there?

text: Factor it in when integrating over the outcomes

elements.text: Factor it in when integrating over the outcomes

text: `[return if win] x [probability win] + [return if dead heat] x [probability dead heat] + [return if not win] x [probability not win]`

elements.text: [return if win] x [probability win] + [return if dead heat] x [probability dead heat] + [return if not win] x [probability not win]

text: Might need to break that down into two-way dead heat, three-way dead heat etc.

elements.text: Might need to break that down into two-way dead heat, three-way dead heat etc.

text: Thanks. That makes sense, yeah think it would be max 2 or 3 dead heats that would be worth doing it for but can check my sims for max winners.

elements.text: Thanks. That makes sense, yeah think it would be max 2 or 3 dead heats that would be worth doing it for but can check my sims for max winners.

text: "Over the past 15 years the technology at the heart of our business has produced consistent and significant returns for our clients". Why have clients if you are successful? You only need to reinvest your own money, and then all profits go to yourselves

text: But, based on my past experience, you can do a lot worse for yourself than work for organisations like these. You learn heaps in a short amount of time, that will be useful for your own applications. Just check the terms of employment about what you can do outside these places of work. A lot of them bar you from betting for yourself while working there
